title: Ocean's Eleven
summary: In this remake of the 1960 Rat Pack heist movie, Clooney plays Danny Ocean, a man of action attempting to orchestrate the most sophisticated, elaborate casino heist in history.
critic_reviews: It's a scrumptious and dizzy-spirited lark, a what-the-hell-let's-rob-the-casino flick made with so much wit and brains and dazzle and virtuosity that the sheer speed and cleverness of the caper hits you like a shot of pure oxygen.
Soderbergh's film will be remembered less for the (inspired) star casting than for being one expertly made piece of pure, unpretentious popcorn entertainment.
Forget Oscar, Ocean's Eleven is the coolest damned thing around.

One thoroughbred of a movie. Sleek, well-muscled and brisk, director Steven Soderbergh's newest offering delivers just about everything anyone could possibly want from filmed entertainment -- except deep thought.

If the new Ocean's Eleven is mostly Clooney's show, he's more than up to the task of carrying it. Indeed, this could be his career-defining role: The twinkle in his eye has never seemed more disreputable, his devil-may-care charm has never seemed so appealing, and he dominates the movie with the graceful ease of a Golden Age Hollywood star.
The most purely entertaining movie to come out of Hollywood so far this year, and if that doesn't seem worthy of Soderbergh's talents, it's worthy enough for a night's amusement.
The movie, in a very real sense, is about the privilege, the sexiness, of being a movie star. Certainly it isn't about the heist; never was.

A champagne bubble of a movie, lively, effervescent and diverting. If it bursts earlier than we'd like -- and it does -- that takes nothing away from the considerable pleasure it provides along the way.
Soderbergh rallies a seismic jolt of enthusiasm, and the movie is an elating blaze of flair and pride.
Together, they (Clooney and Gould) threaten to sneak off with the movie when Soderbergh isn't looking, sowing madness and sex appeal in their wake.
An all-star remake of the all-star original, Ocean's Eleven is a lark for everybody concerned, including the audience. Breezy, nonchalant and without a thing on its mind except having a little fun.
Soderbergh won't hit the Oscar jackpot with Ocean's Eleven, but he has come up with a stylish winner.
It's a kick, it's a gas, and it gives the Rat Pack itself a run for its money.
In her byplay with Clooney, Roberts only occasionally strikes a spark. Clooney, on the other hand, generates heat.
A caper that rarely goes wrong.
It's not deep for a second -- indeed, it repels depth deliberately as if allergic to it -- but it's as swell a swell time as grown-ups could want at the movies.
Serious pianists sometimes pound out a little honky-tonk, just for fun. That's like what Steven Soderbergh is doing in Ocean's Eleven.

Soderbergh -- helms a much tighter and arguably cooler film --  even if the only thing audiences are likely to remember about this Ocean's Eleven is that, while they were watching it, they enjoyed it tremendously
Soderbergh and writer Ted Griffin added plot twists that will catch you off-guard, dumped the clever ending and worked in a love story that's as superfluous as elevator shoes on Shaquille O'Neal.
Good, expensive, easygoing fun. It's no masterpiece, but why should Soderbergh --  or anybody -- get three in a row?
There's no joy and little playfulness about this caper comedy, which, despite a lighthearted script, has a sober undertone to it, almost a melancholia.
This time, the actors don't seem to be making up the movie as they go along, and they're guided by a gifted director who has earned the right to have some guileless fun.

The movie tells you right up front you're going to get what you came for: big stars, winking inside jokes and a spin on something so familiar it doesn't matter that you don't buy it for one minute. You're not meant to.
The movie is mechanical, but machines can be elegant, even inspired.
The movie is slick and studiously cool -- with plenty of visual flourishes but not too much soul.
Despite dashes of droll dialogue from screenwriter Ted Griffin, the remake aims for cool but instead gets chilly.
Sure, like cotton candy: It doesn't do a thing for you, but it's wickedly sweet as it melts on your tongue.
Too bad it commits the crime of being so intensely average, because what could have been sensational turns out to be merely this week's heist movie.
A pretty good caper comedy for 11-year-old boys -- "heist thriller" would make it sound too ambitious.
Doesn't offer much.

reviews.content: Ocean's Eleven is a very slick, witty and well-crafted heist movie which bases on light-hearted fun rather than violence. Fortunately, that pays off perfectly.
The slick Soderbergh, his team of deft screen writers as well as the A-star ensemble make Oceanâ

This sleak crime comedy was a lot better than I expected. First off, the cast lives up to the hype. Whenever a film manages to get so many great actors together, you know you are in for something interesting and that is exactly what this oneThis sleak crime comedy was a lot better than I expected. First off, the cast lives up to the hype. Whenever a film manages to get so many great actors together, you know you are in for something interesting and that is exactly what this one delivered. In addition, the entire robbery sequence was very intriguing and kept you on the edge of your seat as it was happening. Every character really brought something to the table and in spite of there being so much competition for screen time, it never felt overwhelming in that respect. The thing this film really has going for it, without a doubt, is the banter between Clooney and Pitt. The comedic elements brought to the table by the both of them really helped make this into one of the funnest films I have watched in a while. I am not typically a huge fan of Soderbergh's films, but this one worked well, however there were some negatives. Of course Don Cheadle's accent was...indiscernable. I do not want to comment on whether his accent was good or not, but at times, it was tough to understand what exactly he was trying to say. In addition, I had a tough time sitting here and believing that Julia Roberts was the most attractive and talented actress they could have cast for a role that emphasized her attractiveness. There has to be someone more attractive than her who was interested. Seriously.
One of the best movies I've seen in a while. This very well made and bound.

The witty cast, brilliant heist, and the overall style in this movie is marvelous.  While this movie is actually quite shallow I still find myself returning to watch it.  The interaction between the actors in this movie is oddly quiteThe witty cast, brilliant heist, and the overall style in this movie is marvelous.  While this movie is actually quite shallow I still find myself returning to watch it.  The interaction between the actors in this movie is oddly quite remarkable on screen chemistry.  The mindless banter and the brilliant heist will keep you smiling until the credits roll.  Maybe it's just me but I found Don Cheadle's British accent to be a bit cheesy and almost cringe-worthy.  But other than that this is a brilliant movie.  Enjoy!
Is a Great Movie. It has a lot to offer for those who enjoy plot twist and witty movies. Its a must watch and I would say is one of the greatest movies of all times.

This movie was great. The acting was amazing. The story was filled with details and was just very fun to watch. It also has an awesome ending, one I didn’t expect. The heist felt real, and I think they did a great job making it. I recommend it.

Start the car at your own risk, the getaway driver has another place to be.Ocean's Eleven

Soderberg's smoothest and underappreciated trilogy started from this standard chapter. I'd like to think that this is very much in similar to RianStart the car at your own risk, the getaway driver has another place to be.Ocean's ElevenSoderberg's smoothest and underappreciated trilogy started from this standard chapter. I'd like to think that this is very much in similar to Rian Johnson's films. In the sense that the plot is incredibly thick and easily flamboyant in any circumstances it faces, as a result the storyline flips, turns, detours and shoots straight before reaching its destination. Now if a viewers isn't in sync with the on going gag or banal plans, the final product might come off quite textbook. Now, I don't know whether the script is written with such reverse engineering in mind or is always up for investing on engaging flim flams.The director Steven Soderberg has created history for me while making this trilogy. There have been plenty of multi-starrer films as such but none of them went by as swiftly as this one does. And the trick he uses is not to keep these characters linked scene by scene and instead the object that serves the objective. And then, face changes, agendas changes, plan changes and the team changes but the objective stands tall.Despite having an incredible cast, Brad Pitt and George Clooney are mostly standing ahead in the queue. And why wouldn't they, their repartee, between a huge heist going down, about little thing is what makes it rain in this night. The small talks, the actual talks, the bone and not the meat of the material comes when Pitt and Clooney is waiting for something. Kind of like they are in between reality and fantasy, the past and the future, where they stand in present solving an entirely different solution. Almost as if that window is for you to see, not for the characters or even any other viewers, just for me. Ocean's Eleven isn't actually the name they came up with, it should have been called The Benedict Job, I mean they all agreed to it.
Just give this movie and OSCAR !!!! Best movie of all time !Totally Amazing the most rewatch able movie of all time.

Ocean's Eleven is the slickest of heist movies, perfectly paced, star-studded, excellently acted by its entire cast, exciting in parts, funny in others, and visually brilliant in every single scene.  This is one of the few movies that, if on,Ocean's Eleven is the slickest of heist movies, perfectly paced, star-studded, excellently acted by its entire cast, exciting in parts, funny in others, and visually brilliant in every single scene.  This is one of the few movies that, if on, I have to watch until the end.

It's hard to imagine a movie cooler than "Ocean's Eleven", which has so much star power, style, in-jokes, and witty dialogue that it almost seems like the entire city of Hollywood was in on the production. The ending is genuinely surprisingIt's hard to imagine a movie cooler than "Ocean's Eleven", which has so much star power, style, in-jokes, and witty dialogue that it almost seems like the entire city of Hollywood was in on the production. The ending is genuinely surprising and well-done, and doesn't overcomplicate things or insult the audience's intelligence. For simple but fizzy entertainment, "Ocean's Eleven" is a blast.
Is not the greatest movie I have seen. While its not that bad, Oceans 11 is sometimes lame and boring and the only actor, who really does a good job is brad pitt. Has a few good jokes though

One of the first Soderbergh movies I have encountered. Despite the preposterously shallow plot, Soderbergh's stylish direction, splendid acting from the cast (especially Brad Pitt), and witty humor easily makes this movie one of the bestOne of the first Soderbergh movies I have encountered. Despite the preposterously shallow plot, Soderbergh's stylish direction, splendid acting from the cast (especially Brad Pitt), and witty humor easily makes this movie one of the best heist films I have seen in my life.

A very good heist movie, Eleven delivers. Clooney is suave and collected in his role as Danny Ocean, and plays the part well. As it unfolds, the story gets even more fun, especially with its stellar cast.
Witty, Inventive, and above all, Entertaining.Ocean's Eleven ignites with an all star cast, and a slew of impressive performances and intelligent dialogue.

The most entertaining and most badass movie ever!the cast was exciting to watch literally every moment in this movie felt humuriously satisfying and what an ending felt real badass myself watching this awesome movie!every situations wasThe most entertaining and most badass movie ever!the cast was exciting to watch literally every moment in this movie felt humuriously satisfying and what an ending felt real badass myself watching this awesome movie!every situations was thrilling music does that too it was effective the ocean is literally charmed over such great cast amazing performance!Obviously a Classic!
Excellent re-make of the 1960 classic.Slick, well pacedd heist movie, that combines razzle & dazzle with wit and humour.One of 2001's best movies.
Not even as good as the original, and that wasn't very good to begin with, "Ocean'se 11" is a star-studded piece of tripe of questionable morality and ethics. The sequel is likely to be worse.

George Clooney and Brad Pitt lead a fantastic cast in Ocean's Eleven. The plot is also very interesting and the movie and characters, even though there are a lot of them, develop rather nicely. My favorite character is probably Don Cheadle'sGeorge Clooney and Brad Pitt lead a fantastic cast in Ocean's Eleven. The plot is also very interesting and the movie and characters, even though there are a lot of them, develop rather nicely. My favorite character is probably Don Cheadle's though. He plays the role of reckless british explosives nut flawlessly. I thought there were a few plot holes but none that actually affected the critical plot points regarding the heist so they are easily overlooked. I think they could've spent more time on the actual heist/planning process but the movie would've probably been too long if they did. Overall, this is a really good movie with solid acting and, while it's isn't exciting, it still provides for some nice entertainment value.

Classic Soderbergh. Ocean's Eleven begins an unlikely franchise of sly and cunning hooligans. George Clooney and Julia Roberts are wonderful together--not to mention their extremely talented co-stars.
Dizzyingly energetic and jazzy, Ocean's Eleven is a spicy action film that is elevated to the heights by its jaw-dropping cast, fast-paced action and clever storytelling.

Ocean's Eleven, a Vegas-based heist movie is one of the smoothest movies ever created. This movie packs a punch with a meticulously planned plot and an all-star cast featuring, Brad Pitt, Matt Damon and George Clooney. Confusing at times,Ocean's Eleven, a Vegas-based heist movie is one of the smoothest movies ever created. This movie packs a punch with a meticulously planned plot and an all-star cast featuring, Brad Pitt, Matt Damon and George Clooney. Confusing at times, this movie is always up to the mark with excitement and humour and I believe it has everything a heist movie requires. This is one of the movies that no matter how many times you watch it, you don't mind watching it again.

Featuring A tight script, some chic imagery, cool performances, and enough twists and turns to give you one madly gratifying case of whiplash, "Ocean's Eleven" further proves Steven Soderbergh's sharp skill within the cinematic craft.
Entertaining but fairly bland, funny but not overly so. Extremely preposterous, even for this type of movie. The execution of the heist is quite entertaining, as is Don Cheadle's english accent.

The best in the 'Ocean' series. Ocean's 11 is one of the most notable heist films ever made and in my opinion should have been a stand alone film. This remake is original in its ability to make the audience wonder how this team of misfitsThe best in the 'Ocean' series. Ocean's 11 is one of the most notable heist films ever made and in my opinion should have been a stand alone film. This remake is original in its ability to make the audience wonder how this team of misfits will get away with such an elaborate heist.
Ocean's Eleven is a very slick, witty and well-crafted heist movie which bases on light-hearted fun rather than violence. Fortunately, that pays off perfectly.

One of the greatest heist movies every made. It is smart, sharp and suprisingly very funny and heartfelt. I think that Ocean's Eleven is a must see for film lovers; it is awesome despite some of its flaws.

Ocean´s Eleven was a film with a different story with very good characters that were adapted from the original series, the story was good and the intrigue is present as it happens in this type of movies.

I haven't seen the 1960 film for a while, and plan to re watch it shortly. But I will say I did enjoy very much this film. True, there are a lot of characters so sometimes the film feels shallow, and sometimes the pacing is a tad tooI haven't seen the 1960 film for a while, and plan to re watch it shortly. But I will say I did enjoy very much this film. True, there are a lot of characters so sometimes the film feels shallow, and sometimes the pacing is a tad too pedestrian. But there are a number of things that made it a slick and well done film. First, the direction was excellent. Steven Soderbergh is a talented director, and he direction is super efficient. The plot is good, about Danny Ocean and his ten accomplices planning to rob three Las Vegas casinos simultaneously. The soundtrack is cool, the cinematography is professional and the script is witty. But it is the stellar performances that make the film. George Clooney, Julia Roberts, Brad Pitt, Elliot Gould and Bernie Mac all give fun performances, elevating what could've been a predictable and unoriginal film into a quite enjoyable one. 8/10 Bethany Cox
A quite good heist film, being the cast its strongest point. The script is enjoyable and unpredictable.

Slick and entertaining film that's packed with energetic players and wonderful direction courtesy of Steven Soderburgh. George Clooney and Brad Pitt lead a very likable and humorous crew on a what's perceived as an impossible heist Slick and entertaining film that's packed with energetic players and wonderful direction courtesy of Steven Soderburgh. George Clooney and Brad Pitt lead a very likable and humorous crew on a what's perceived as an impossible heist from a Las Vegas casino have security which on a par with Fort Knox. The team assembled is certainly shady given their tarnished backgrounds (accomplished via impressive flashback clips and clever montage sequences which are informative as they are entertaining) and couldn't have less in common personality-wise yet collectively gel into a well-oiled machine which convince you their mission could actually be attainable. Even with the given skeletons present in their respective pasts you still find yourself rooting for these 'bad' guys. Andy Garcia is great as the stooge and ultimate fall guy who gets a deserved comeupance and the added tension of Clooney's team attempting to pull off the caper with unexpected hurdles makes the confusion and chaos a more than welcomed plot entanglement. Great shots of Vegas throughout - especially the night sequences - and Julia Roberts is very graceful as the independent, freethinking woman caught in between two demanding men.

If you can only make one-dimensional characters, make this kind of movie. Ocean's Eleven is simple throughout but twists all that simplicity into complexity; it's shallow but broad, and especially cool. The whole production is If you can only make one-dimensional characters, make this kind of movie. Ocean's Eleven is simple throughout but twists all that simplicity into complexity; it's shallow but broad, and especially cool. The whole production is slick and moves in ways that other directors should envy. The gratuitously star-studded cast helps add further spectacle atop a movie where the plot the characters hatch is far more entertaining than the plot the movie does. Ocean's Eleven is another of those fun movies that are more entertaining with every additional friend you watch it with.
Very cool, very funny, and most importantly very entertaining. The perfect film!

I actually give it a 9.1. The screenplay and dialogue is written so cleverly, and the actors deliver in a spectacular performance. This movie redefines the word cool, as big name actors pull off the slickest heist ever to hit the screen. The I actually give it a 9.1. The screenplay and dialogue is written so cleverly, and the actors deliver in a spectacular performance. This movie redefines the word cool, as big name actors pull off the slickest heist ever to hit the screen. The music is also the most inspiring and fitting music I've heard, sticking to that same cool vibe. Even if it is a far departure of the original film, it still is a great, fun flick to spend 2 hours watching.
A very enjoyable heist film with good acting, writing and smarts to spare. Good stuff.
Very good movie and you notice something new every time you watch it. Great cast, very interesting twist on the heist genre.

Very funny and entertaining from start to finish! It's filled with plot twists and witty jokes. Despite the large number of characters, they all have unique personalities and as a result their interactions are humorous.
Ocean's Eleven just has that originality that keeps the story fresh and clean. Hey, let's go rob a casino and call it a day. Okay, but first let me get my supplies.

Rob three casinos in one night, why not? Here they know how to get the best out of bringing together the best possible cast, and give time on how the plan will be done so that it seems as plausible as possible; something that we shouldRob three casinos in one night, why not? Here they know how to get the best out of bringing together the best possible cast, and give time on how the plan will be done so that it seems as plausible as possible; something that we should appreciate as a spectator. To see a weekend afternoon.
The plot confuses me.  I watched it 3 times.  I like the scenery.  And I wish I had bags of money.  Maybe I will watch it again.  I need to watch movies to stay distracted.

Steven Sodergergh's Ocean's 11 is THE best heist film that I have ever seen. I love the story, I love the characters, and I love the humor. And I loved the antagonist, Andy Garcia's Terry Benedict. In the end, I love this film and I'm goingSteven Sodergergh's Ocean's 11 is THE best heist film that I have ever seen. I love the story, I love the characters, and I love the humor. And I loved the antagonist, Andy Garcia's Terry Benedict. In the end, I love this film and I'm going to give it an 8.8/10

Overrated, somewhat dull and boring. Even though Soderbergh's charm and the drama between the team holds up as rewatchable entertainment. It's a cool film, but lacking personality at times which the follow-up films have in spades.  It's stillOverrated, somewhat dull and boring. Even though Soderbergh's charm and the drama between the team holds up as rewatchable entertainment. It's a cool film, but lacking personality at times which the follow-up films have in spades.  It's still a solid outing, and probably the most consistent and iconic tonal film of the trilogy. Not a classic, but it poses as one.

This movie tells the attempt to rob the vault of three major Las Vegas casinos by a group of professional thieves led by Danny Ocean (George Clooney). It's a very light film, made for entertaining, with an improbable but fun plot, full ofThis movie tells the attempt to rob the vault of three major Las Vegas casinos by a group of professional thieves led by Danny Ocean (George Clooney). It's a very light film, made for entertaining, with an improbable but fun plot, full of moments of intelligent humor that look good in the movie. In addition to Clooney, who has done here one of his most popular works, we have Brad Pitt, Bernie Mac, Elliott Gould, Carl Reiner, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia and Julia Roberts among others. Clooney and Pitt stood out for the positive, being able to amuse and to make humor without losing the charm of their characters or overshadowing the colleagues. The story is relatively simple but allows almost all actors to have room to appear. And although I said the story is unlikely, the biggest problem of the script for me was the love trio Clooney-Roberts-Garcia. The idea was good, but it did not work out because Julia Roberts never seemed very willing. The romantic chemistry between her and her two colleagues was zero and I ended up thinking about what the actress really thought she was doing in the movie. Andy Garcia has already made more inspirational performances but was decent enough on his character. The scenarios are very good and realistic, from the safe to the gaming rooms, and the great sights of Las Vegas are truly beautiful and look good on the screen. The soundtrack is great and stays in the ear.

Ocean's Eleven is a fun crowd-pleaser that will resonate in many people's heart. The script is very witty and funny, and packs many surprises and some fun characters along the way. The ending is unexpected but still makes sense at the sameOcean's Eleven is a fun crowd-pleaser that will resonate in many people's heart. The script is very witty and funny, and packs many surprises and some fun characters along the way. The ending is unexpected but still makes sense at the same time. The script messes with your brain, makes you get all the possible solutions and still be wrong. The cast is very good and the sets are fantastic, especially the duplicate bank vault scene. While it definitely is slow for the first half and the editing is choppy in some places, that doesn't disguise a brilliantly made second half of the film.
This 3 movies were great. I watched them all several times and can recommend to anyone.

The casinos of three Las Vegas casinos converge in a single vault. It is, on the occasion, 163 million dollars. This is what Ocean, released from prison, is aiming for. Plan the shot with a friend of his. Specialists in every field areThe casinos of three Las Vegas casinos converge in a single vault. It is, on the occasion, 163 million dollars. This is what Ocean, released from prison, is aiming for. Plan the shot with a friend of his. Specialists in every field are recruited, the best ones. The casinos belong to a single owner, certainly Tony Benedict, very organized and, if it happens, very cruel. We also learn that Tess, Ocean's ex-wife (but he's always very much in love) is with Benedict. For Ocean it would therefore be a double revenge. The robbery succeeds: super-technological. And the reconciliation between Tess and Ocean is also successful.A nicely made movie of light entertainment.

Ocean's Eleven is a quite soft, fluent and entertaining heist movie, without a violance. Plans are very subsidiary one another also they contain a lot of fun. It makes audience like watching a fast moving chess play.
This remake of the original remains a great remake of a classic with George Clooney and Brad Pitt in it.
Really fun, but lost two points for Brad Pitt's wig, and some inexplicable details to the heist.
